item.title: Report X-2025010714
item.description:
Report X-2025010714

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF Operation Supervisor states that they opened up trailer 5553196 in dock door 98 when they found 1 pail of UN3066, PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, 8, PGII had leaked about 6 fl oz onto the trailer floor. ABF Supervisor states that is was caused during transit due to the load shifting around and not havin g any duntage around the freight resulting in a tiny bit to leak out after the freight next to it scraped it.

item.title: Report E-2025010199
item.description:
Report E-2025010199

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-15
  • City: EASTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 15, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN3266 was damaged and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and pavement beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted site. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and pavement swept them in with hand tools. All waste was collected and containerized into three (3) 55-gallon drums and staged onsite.

item.title: Report E-2025010230
item.description:
Report E-2025010230

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-23T21:13:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: LANCASTER
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNIVAR SOLUTIONS INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A release of an estimated 20 gallons of Sodium hypochlorite occurred during a bulk delivery at a customer site. The delivery point is located on the outside of the building. The leak was on the customer's piping system inside the building. The material was captured in containment. The release occurred within the first 15-20 seconds of the transfer. The customer stated that the leak was located where recent maintenance had been performed. There were no injuries. Our driver was overseeing the unload so we are submitting this DOT 5800 report.

item.title: Report E-2025010132
item.description:
Report E-2025010132

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0308 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCA. It was reported that approximately 4-gallons of Tremco PUMA Primer - 6 GAL released from a metal pail due to a forklift puncture. The release impacted inside of trailer #3234938. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site.

item.title: Report E-2025010129
item.description:
Report E-2025010129

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-18
  • City: CARLISLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0231 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BCA. It was reported that approximately 1-cup of Nitric Acid released from a metal drum due a packaging defect by the shipper. The release impacted the top of the drum only. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-cup of UN2031 Nitric Acid product released at top of the metal drum lid 24” area due to not being tighten enough. The contractors replaced the bung cap, and shake tested the drum and used absorbent rags to wipe up the spill, then containerized the impacted rags and a goosenecked bag of PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2025010020
item.description:
Report I-2025010020

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-17T06:18:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-22
  • City: BRADENVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: DELTA AIR LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Delta's DG Management Group was notified on 11/23/2024 of a cell phone overheat event that occurred on 11/22/2024 during during the deplaning phase of flight(DL602). A passenger's cell phone overheated and a fire was observed. The customer used a beverage to extinguish the flame that immediately mitigated the event. The flight attendant was ready to use a fire extinguisher if needed. No injuries were reported. The crew initiated a gate evacuation via forward boarding door using same direction of deplaning. The NRC and FAA were notified. 1
